item.title: Instagram courts TikTok users with algorithm revamp
item.description: With TikTok's future uncertain, Instagram is trying to get more viral content on its Reels feature.

item.title: Have the wheels come off for Tesla?
item.description: As the electric carmaker sees sales fall and cuts jobs, we take a closer look at its problems.

item.title: Electric car driver turned away from hospital car park
item.description: Experts say it does not make sense as research suggests petrol cars are much more likely to catch fire.

item.title: Apple sales fall in nearly all countries
item.description: The tech giant says demand for its smartphones fell more than 10% in the first three months of the year.

item.title: TikTok and Universal settle music royalties dispute
item.description: The deal means songs from artists including Ariana Grande and Drake can be used on the platform again.

item.title: Uber faces £250m London black cab drivers case
item.description: The case against the US-based ride-hailing giant is being brought on behalf of over 10,800 drivers.

item.title: Apple working to fix alarming iPhone issue
item.description: Users have been reporting unexpected lie-ins after the alarms on their phones failed to go off.

item.title: OnlyFans investigated over children accessing porn
item.description: Ofcom suspects the platform is not doing enough to stop under-18s accessing explicit material.

item.title: Tesla staff say entire Supercharger team fired
item.description: The division responsible for the car-maker's huge fast-charging network is being axed to cut costs.

item.title: Tens of millions secretly use WhatsApp despite bans
item.description: Will Cathcart reveals how many people are secretly using his app in countries where it is banned.

item.title: Binance crypto boss sentenced to 4 months in prison
item.description: Changpeng Zhao, head of world's largest crypto platform, pleaded guilty to breaking US money laundering laws.

item.title: Beijing tightens grip on China social media giants
item.description: Changes to China's State Secrets Law requires internet firms to monitor information shared by users.

item.title: Hacker jailed for blackmailing therapy patients
item.description: Julius Kivimäki threatened thousands of patients he would publish details of their therapy sessions.

item.title: Meta faces EU probe over Russian disinformation
item.description: The EU says Facebook and Instagram have not done enough to combat "malicious actors'" political ads.

item.title: Bumble boss: What women in tech can learn from me
item.description: Lidiane Jones says women have to turn the career barriers they still face to their advantage.

item.title: Tesla China rival BYD sees profits and sales fall
item.description: Car maker takes a hit from weakening demand and price war in the world's largest electric vehicle market.

item.title: Tesla shares jump after reports of China deal
item.description: A reported deal with Chinese search giant Baidu will help pave the way for a rollout of Tesla's self-driving technology.

item.title: US probes Ford hands-free driving tech after crashes
item.description: The US regulator says it will evaluate Ford's driver assistance tech after two fatal collisions.

item.title: New law aims to protect devices from hackers
item.description: Speakers, fitness trackers and other internet-connected devices sold in the UK now have to meet new requirements.

item.title: Musk in China to discuss enabling Full Self Driving
item.description: China is Tesla's second-biggest market but the company has not enabled autonomous driving in the country.

item.title: Airline keeps mistaking 101-year-old woman for baby
item.description: An IT glitch leaves the cabin crew expecting to welcome a baby on board rather than a centenarian.

item.title: Tesla Autopilot recall to be probed by US regulator
item.description: The regulator will check whether Tesla's fix adequately addressed safety concerns.

item.title: US TikTok ban would be 'devastating', UK firms warn
item.description: UK businesses using TikTok say they could see a significant drop in sales if the app is banned in the US.

item.title: Meta AI spending plans cause share price slump
item.description: Investors react badly to the Facebook and WhatsApp owner spending more than anticipated on AI.

item.title: TikTok vows to fight 'unconstitutional' US ban
item.description: The app faces being banned or sold in the US because of national security concerns.

item.title: Tesla profits slump by more than a half
item.description: The EV maker brings forward launch plans for new models as profits drop by more than half.

item.title: Spotify turns up volume to make record profits
item.description: The music streaming service reports record profits of over €1bn (£860m) after laying off 1500 staff.

item.title: How robots are taking over warehouse work
item.description: At Ocado's newest warehouse robotic arms are helping to pack customer orders.

item.title: Australia PM calls Elon Musk an 'arrogant billionaire'
item.description: Anthony Albanese's comments come amid a feud over X's reluctance to remove footage of a stabbing.

item.title: Three-year-olds groomed online, charity warns
item.description: IWF says many were likely filmed remotely while using phones or other handheld devices at home.

item.title: EU may suspend money-for-views TikTok feature
item.description: The feature, which pays users to go on TikTok, could be temporarily suspended as early as Thursday.

item.title: Grindr sued for allegedly revealing users' HIV status
item.description: The LGBTQ+ dating app is being sued in a class action lawsuit over allegedly misusing users' data.

item.title: Can touchless tech create 'equitable' gaming?
item.description: Click reporter Paul Carter has a go at playing Minecraft with his eyes.

item.title: Tesla cuts prices in major markets as sales fall
item.description: The move comes after the firm reported a sharp fall in deliveries in the first three months of 2024.

item.title: Tech Life: TikTok world
item.description: TikTok is a popular video sharing platform, but not so popular with some governments.

item.title: How fraudsters are getting fake articles onto Facebook
item.description: Scammers are able to get past automated checks on the social media giant to try to defraud users.

item.title: Tech Life: Humanoid robots
item.description: Are they really that practical and useful?

item.title: Watch Ocado robots in action
item.description: Ocado has added robotic arms to its newest warehouse near Luton.

item.title: Tech Life: Fixing undersea cables
item.description: Undersea fibre-optic cables help keep us online - but what happens when they break?

item.title: Robot dog trains to walk on Moon in Oregon trials
item.description: US engineering team has a two-year, $2m grant to help Nasa study the Moon's surface.

item.title: Tech Life: Space Junk
item.description: We look at what space junk is and the risk it poses to tech we use everyday.

item.title: Tech Life: Predicting the future of tech
item.description: How will the internet, and other tech we use today, evolve in the future?

item.title: Tech Life: Charging electric bikes and scooters
item.description: What can be done to make charging them safer?

item.title: Neuralink patient seen playing chess using brain implant
item.description: In a livestream on X, the patient explained that he was using a device in his brain to move the cursor.

item.title: Tech Life
item.description: We look at some of the reasons you choose your mobile phone handset

item.title: Watch: Musk and son visit Tesla plant after fire
item.description: A far-left activist group took responsibility for the fire, which left the plant without power for nearly a week.

item.title: Tech Life
item.description: We visit two centres developing deep space communications and rocket launches.

item.title: BBC Verify: How to spot AI fakes in the US election
item.description: The BBC's Marianna Spring explains the key to recognising AI-generated images circulating on social media.

item.title: How the computer games industry is embracing AI
item.description: Developing computer games can be wildly expensive so some hope that AI can cut the cost.

item.title: The insect farmers turning to AI to help lower costs
item.description: Makers of insect-based animal feed hope to be able to compete with soybeans on price.

item.title: After 20 years, what next for World of Warcraft?
item.description: The game's maker Activision Blizzard was bought by Microsoft last year in gaming's biggest ever acquisition

item.title: How Chinese firms are using Mexico as a backdoor to the US
item.description: Chinese firms are racing to set up factories in Mexico to bypass US tariffs and sanctions.

item.title: Can AI help solve Japan’s labour shortages?
item.description: Japan is seeing if artificial intelligence can tackle its increasing shortfall of workers.

item.title: Why a deluge of Chinese-made drugs is hard to curb
item.description: Thousands of Chinese companies are making synthetic opioids and shipping them around the world.

item.title: 'AI helps me to make wine for younger drinkers'
item.description: The winemakers using artificial intelligence to help them grow grapes and blend their wines.

item.title: The challenge of upgrading iconic steel windows
item.description: Critall windows date back to the 1880s but their steel construction makes them vulnerable to damp.

item.title: Boom times for US green energy as federal cash flows in
item.description: The US government has directed unprecedented sums of money at green energy projects.

item.title: The rise of magnets – from surgery to outer space
item.description: Magnets are central to much modern technology and firms are racing to make them more efficient.

item.title: Tackling deepfakes 'has turned into an arms race'
item.description: The battle against fake images, video and audio is becoming ever harder as the tech improves.

item.title: Could AI take the grind out of accountancy?
item.description: AI could mean fewer accountancy jobs but is also taking over some of the more mundane tasks.

item.title: India in undersea race to mine world’s battery metal
item.description: The country has applied for two new licences to explore the deep seabed in parts of the Indian Ocean.

item.title: 'Journalists are feeding the AI hype machine'
item.description: AI reporters and experts discuss how well or otherwise the media covers the topic.

item.title: Once India's most valuable start-up, Byju's is now fighting to survive
item.description: The ed-tech giant is teetering on the precipice after some investors voted to out its CEO last month.

item.title: 'I'd heard the big, bad, scary conversation about AI'
item.description: The women enrolling on artificial intelligence training courses to boost their job prospects.
